node.doctext:
CST review archive 12

This is a storage node for CST reviews. Contents are moved her from [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 3/26/04, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_13].

See also Quest Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1], [CST_Storage_2|2], [CST_Storage_3|3], [CST_Storage_4|4], [CST_Storage_5|5], [CST_Storage_6|6], [CST_Storage_7|7], [CST_Storage_8|8], [CST_Storage_9|9], [CST_Storage_10|10], [CST_Storage_11|11], [CST_Storage_12|12].

04/24/04 Batch processed by gom part 2, part 1 is in [CST_Storage_11|11]

Writeup Title:[Hell Looks a Lot Like L.A.]
Author:[pimephalis]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: N
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: N
Compliance Assessment: No, Removed 04/16/04
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.4.6 (1.1 hr) [pimephalis] says dannye has informed me that my w/u at [Hell Looks a Lot Like L.A.] doesn't meet the new c-right standards on E2. Any suggestions/help would be appreciated."
Hi there. I'd be glad to help you with updating this for copyright compliance. Looks like 50% of your wu is quoted material. For fair use, that has to be below 33%. So you've gotta add another 200 words or so of original explication, or cut down the quote. Make sense?
Sorry but this had to go due to copyright problems. If you'd like to update and repost it please let me know.
Tc = 401, Tq = 199, %q= 50%

Writeup Title:[September]
Author:[no comply]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: N
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: N
Compliance Assessment: No, removed 04/16/04
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.4.6 (4.1 min) JohnnyGoodyear says Christ there everywhere. September. First poem is good, but the song is lyrics only....
Hi there. Bad news I'm afraid. This one isn't compliant under the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 copyright policy]. To qualify under fair use, you would need to add another 150 or so words of original explication. I hope you can update it but if not I'll remove it [13 April|in a week].
Sorry but this had to go due to copyright problems. If you'd like to update and repost it please let me know.
Tc = 190, Tq = 167, %q= 88%

Writeup Title:[Let America Be America Again]
Author:[--OutpostMir--]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 100%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.5.21@17:50 [haze] says Langston Hughes' [Let America Be America Again] has suddenly acquired topic interest as Senator Kerry's campaign slogan.

Hi --OutpostMir--, Unfortunately because of the [E2 copyright changes] lyrics can no longer be kept in the database. If you would like to update and resubmit the song you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material ] for ideas and suggestions. Warmest regards.

Writeup Title:[Losing my religion]
Author:[ Ziridescence]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 28%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2004.5.22@0:22 [Ziridescence] says I'm a new noder but I was advised to submit my first writeup for copyright review. I'm not sure how to go about that exactly. My writeup is under the name [Losing my religion]. I would like to do everything I can to make sure that my writeup isn't nuked on the basis of copyright infringement. Thanks!

Hi Ziridescence This is one terrific write up! It compiles with the fair use terms here at E2. It you would like to you may append this hardlink [CST Approved]

Writeup Title:[r-p-o-p-h-e-s-s-a-g-r]
Author:[ism]
Reviewer: [Chris-O]
Public domain?: (N)
Original Author's Permission received?: (N)
Quoted content less than 33%: (Y (19/98)-- see below)
Compliance Assessment: (i'm saying Y)
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2004.05.15 at 15:58 [GrouchyOldMan] says 2004.5.15 (28 s) [dannye] says What about ol' [e. e. cummings|ee]'s stuff? Like [r-p-o-p-h-e-s-s-a-g-r]?
[Chris-O|I] sez: according to [Microsoft Word|microsoft w3rd]'s word count utility (which really had no idea how to deal with ee's poetry) r-p-o-p-h-e-s-s-a-g-r is only 19 words. thusly, according to my interpretation of our rules, this can stay.
however, since this is only my interpretation, i didn't msg [ism] to say it was ok, and won't until i talk to GOM or someone.
GOM said it was OK.
([Chris-O|sent writeup message] "hey. go ahead and stamp this CST Approved 'cause, well, it is.")

Writeup Title:[The Satanic Verses]
Author:[rischi]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: N
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: N
Compliance Assessment: Y
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.5.3 (2.6 hr) Lometa says re CST_Group: I'm not really sure what to do here. The first write up makes The Satanic Verses a great node. Without it it's not worth much, but it looks like it may not be copyright compliant...
/msg Rischi Hi there, this write is compliant with the E2 copyright policy but just barely. I'd like you to consider adding some additional original text to add more of your own thoughts on the subject. Thanks.
Quotes 1, 2, are from the same source, quotes 3,4 & 5 are all from different sources.
Tc = 1013, Tq1+q2 = (113+219) = 332, Tq3 = 196, Tq4 = 121, Tq5 = 69 %q1+q2= (332/1013) = 32.77%, %q3= 19%, %q4 = 12%, %q5 = 7%

Writeup Title:[Puff the Magic Dragon]
Author:[Segnbora-t]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 31%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.4.26@14:20 [GrouchyOldMan] says 2004.4.26 (5.1 hr) [dem bones] says [Puff the Magic Dragon] and [Cain] (by [neil]) are copyright issues, I'd wager...
Hello [Segnbora-t], Unfortunately because of the [E2 copyright changes] [Puff the Magic Dragon] can no longer be kept in the database as it is. There is so much interesting history attached to this song I was wondering if you would consider updating it? For some helpful suggestions and ideas you may want to read through [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. Please let me know what you decide.
2004.5.1@16:51 [Segnbora-t] says I will certainly update [Puff the Magic Dragon] to fit current copyright guidelines -- tomorrow, once I'm settled in for dogsitting at my mom's place. Today will involve doing the settling. 8)
2004.5.4@2:25 [Segnbora-t] says [Puff the Magic Dragon] update done -- tell me what you think (and whether list of album titles count toward non-copyrighted work, and such. 8) )
Looks great [Segnbora-t]! You can append this hardlink [CST Approved] if you would like to. Lists aren’t considered part of copyrighted work. We take the total content of the write up and divide it into the lyrics. You’re right at 31%:) Thanks for updating this I’m glad to see we can keep it!

Writeup Title:[Scar Tissue]
Author:[Amoeba Protozoa]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.

Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.4.7@22:48 [GrouchyOldMan] says Review Request: ) 2004.4.7 (4.7 hr) [JohnnyGoodyear] says [Scar Tissue] by [Amoeba Protozoa].
Hello [Amoeba Protozoa], Unfortunately the song part of this write up is 44% of the original content exceeding the 33% allowed for fair use. You may want to read through [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some ideas. I hope you can update it but if not I'll remove it next [April 17, 2004|Saturday]. If you have any questions, please feel free to message me.
Hey there it’s been a week and I see you haven’t logged on since I msged you about [Scar Tissue]. It’s such a great write up that I’d hate to delete it with out a reply so I’m going to wait for two more weeks hoping to hear from you. (04/17/14)
Hello again, It’s been over three weeks since this was submitted for review and unfortunately I have to remove it. I hope you will consider an update and resubmitting it.(05/01/04)

06/23/04

Writeup Title:[Gerontion]
Author:[Lometa]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: Y
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: Y
Compliance Assessment: Y
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.6.7 (6.9 hr) Lometa says It was published almost simultaneously in England and the US(New York: Alfred A. Knopf, 1920). Since he lived in London at the time I think you're right that it was the London Ovid Press who probably published it first.
Quote 1 is the original poem, published in 1920 thus in the Public Domain. The other quotes are all less than 250 words and are properly cited, thus compliant under fair use.
Overall a masterful and scholarly piece of work. Bravo Lometa!

Writeup Title:[Jochen Rindt]
Author:[Citizen_Erazed]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: 58%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.6.4@15:36 [dannye]says: I would like someone from the CST team to tell me how much cut/paste makes plagiarism? Try the last for example. http://www.histomobile.com/ histomob/prespil.asp?meteo=30&lan=1
2004.6.4@16:32 [Lometa] says 58 % of the write up comes from http://www.ddavid.com/formula1/rindt_bio.htm and http://www.histomobile.com/ histomob/prespil.asp?meteo=30&lan=1. The first paragraph is rewritten well enough in the user’s own words and the fact that they fail to cite sources shows an understanding as to what is plagiarism as well as copyright infringement. This is a clear case of dishonest scholarship and should be removed from the database.
2004.6.4@16:39 [dannye] says OK. It's removed. Thanks.

Writeup Title:[FN M249 Para]
Author:[KitLo]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 93%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2004.5.23@15:34 [GrouchyOldMan] says Did anybody ever get this one reviewed? [FN M249 Para] I think it slipped through the cracks.

Hello [KitLo] Unfortunately because of the [E2 copyright changes] we can no longer host copyrighted works in the database. 93% write up is a copy and paste from http://www.fas.org/man/dod-101/sys/land/m249.htm posted by the Federation of American Scientists webzine. If you would like to update the information and resubmit it you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some suggestions and ideas.

Writeup Title:[There Is a Light that Never Goes Out]
Author:[bigmouth_strikes]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: Yes
Quoted content less than 33%: 24%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.5.23@1:19 [GrouchyOldMan] says Review Request: 2004.5.17 (1.1 min) [dannye] says I'm not sure about [There Is a Light that Never Goes Out], but it might need a look.

[bigmouth_strikes] shows a reasonable familiarity with tablature in his first write up [Bigmouth Strikes Again]. He also comments, “Analysis by John Levon, moz@compsoc.man.ac.uk, republished with kind permission.”

Hello [bigmouth_strikes]. This write up has been submitted to [Content_Salvage] for review and has passed with flying colors! You may append this hardlink [CST Approved] Thank you:)

Writeup Title:[ May 27, 2004]
Author:[heyoka]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: Yes.
Quoted content less than 33%: 100%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.5.27@10:03 Lometa says Hello [heyoka], Unfortunately because of the [E2 copyright changes] copyrighted works like the article can no longer be hosted by the database unless they meet the guidelines of fair use. At this time the article cited is 52% of the original content. I was wondering if you would please consider adding more original content or cite parts of the article? You might want to read through [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for more suggestions and ideas. If the content hasn’t been amended in [5/29/04|48 hours] it will have to be removed.

2004.5.27@15:07 heyoka says sorry. i am rather confused. it's a press release written by me, that i've sent to newspapers. i am the copyright holder. the katie cooke in the article = me.

2004.5.27@16:18 Lometa says If you are the copyright holder then you may want to add the CST approved tag and cite yourself as giving permission so that it is clear to the readers…

2004.5.27@15:15 heyoka says isn't it already clear? given that contact name in the press release is me? and linked to me?

2004.5.27@15:18 (heyoka) Lometa says re May 27, 2004: Not it's not clear. There is no byline or statement by you making it clear.

2004.5.27@15:24 heyoka says changed the wording from 'the press release' to 'my press release'. Does that clarify the situation enough?

2004.5.27@15:25 (heyoka) Lometa says re May 27, 2004: Much better. Thank you very much.

2004.5.27@15:27 heyoka says you are very welcome, Ms. Lometa :)

2004.5.29 @ 14:02:06 Well [SkiBum5] it’s been two weeks and this has to go, I hope you’ll consider updating it and resubmitting it to the database…

you said "re I Remember California : heya. this doesn't quite fit under Fair Use rules. if you lose the main quotation of the lyrics (you can keep the ones mixed with the text; in fact, please do), then it can stay. please msg [Chris-O|me] or [Content_Salvage] ", "when you do. thanks!" to Tlachtga (sent 2 message parts to 1 noder)
26 May: [Chris-O] sez well, talking to [GrouchyOldMan|GOM], it's been decided that we can't wait any longer for [tlatchga] to come back. so bye bye it goes.

Writeup Title:[Memo To Yalies: Grow Up]
Author:[iandunn]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 85%
Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.5.28@17:01 [dannye] says How does [Memo To Yalies: Grow Up] fit in w/ our new © guidelines?

Hello [iandunn], Unfortunately because of the [E2 copyright changes] we can no long host copyrighted works on the server. I was wondering if you would please consider updating this by adding more original content or citing parts of the article. Right now the copyrighted work is 85% and to meet fair use it cannot exceed 33%. You may want to read through [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. Please let me know what you decide by next [06/05/04|Saturday]. If there has been no update by then it will be removed.

2004.5.29@15:09 [iandunn] says That's ok, you can go ahead and nuke it.
